vAnnotate

Annotate Javascript code with variable values at runtime

vAnnotate logs variable assignment, function calls etc during execution and then overlays the source code with the collected data.

Here's an example - hover over the variables to see their values: 

function add(a, b){
    return a + b;
}

var sum = add(3,4);
sum *= 5;

vAnnotate on Github



Run it locally

vAnnotate is on npm:

sudo npm install -g vannotate

Then run vAnnotate in a folder containing a static website. The directory will be served at localhost:7000 and when you open an html file the Javascript code it loads will be annotated.

You can see annotated files at localhost:7000/vAnnotate/results.
